intro: Wahlenbergia huillana var. pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf fairy-bluebell, is a small flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Its compact size and vibrant blooms make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine arrangements. Wahlenbergia huillana var. pusilla is also noted for its ability to thrive in cooler climates and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
